{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3479519,"name":"Steve Nelson","username":"zenman","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/z/e9a140/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-11T23:17:40.853Z","cooked":"

I can’t tell if we are doing something wrong or our vivid radio doesn’t work.

I have powered it with a 12v dc power supply.

I have connected an ethernet to the roborio
I have connected an ethernet to my laptop.
The power, SYS and the robot lights are green.
Two more lights are off. I think they are both wifi leds
The “radio” light on the roborio is off

When all three dipswitches are set to off, I was able to access radio.local in the browser.

I was able to enter my team number in. I put values in for the WPA fields, but I’m not certain what those are for. the Docs didn’t explain that well.

My laptop’s ip is 10.92.14.20 (team number 9214, so that much is good)

I tried both the robot radio mode and the access point mode.

I tried flipping the #3 dipswitch to on (AP). Although when i do that I can no long access radio.local.

The roborio radio led won’t light up. I don’t see the FRC-9214 (or whatever the name is) in the list of wifi networks on my laptop.

What am I doing wrong??

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-01-11T23:18:36.009Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":118,"reads":193,"readers_count":192,"score":623.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":481073,"topic_slug":"setting-up-the-vivid-radio","display_username":"Steve Nelson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/new-radio-not-appearing-on-computer/493002/3","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"New radio not appearing on computer?","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70736,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"mentor"},"post_url":"/t/setting-up-the-vivid-radio/481073/1","custom_user_title":"mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3479631,"name":"Steve Nelson","username":"zenman","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/z/e9a140/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-12T01:40:46.972Z","cooked":"

Some minor updates.

We found that if the roborio ethernet is disconnected and the laptop’s ethernet is connected and the 3rd dipswitch is on, suddenly the wifi seems to come on. Doesn’t make any sense.

We were able to update the firmware. But… the radio light on the roborio still doesn’t turn on.

The ethernet lights on the radio are blinking green and the ethernet on the roborio are blinking yellow with a solid green. But the RADIO light under the status on the rio is still out. The status is blinking twice, then turns off for about 5 seconds.

The two blinking lights on the rio means “No code”. That makes sense! We’ve been trying to upload code, but can’t connect.

zenman:

The status is blinking twice, then turns off for about 5 seconds.

zenman:

The two blinking lights on the rio means “No code”.

The status LED blinking twice means “Software error, reimage roboRIO”.

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Status Light Quick Reference

Many of the components of the FRC ® Control System have indicator lights that can be used to quickly diagnose problems with your robot. This guide shows each of the hardware components and describe...

Like @cmdada said, the radio LED is not used by the roboRIO image to signal any status. It is expected to be off unless the user is setting it in their code.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-01-12T02:09:05.230Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":2,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":122,"readers_count":121,"score":39.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":481073,"topic_slug":"setting-up-the-vivid-radio","display_username":"Ryan Blue","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/hardware/hardware-basics/status-lights-ref.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Status Light Quick Reference — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/setting-up-the-vivid-radio/481073/6","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3479667,"name":"Steve Nelson","username":"zenman","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/z/e9a140/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-12T02:49:43.703Z","cooked":"

The 3rd dipswitch is set to on.

What do you mean the radio light is not used for this? The driver station light is red, it should be green.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-01-12T02:49:43.703Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":103,"readers_count":102,"score":40.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":481073,"topic_slug":"setting-up-the-vivid-radio","display_username":"Steve Nelson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":60586,"username":"cmdada","name":"Ada T","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cmdada/{size}/230870_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70736,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"mentor"},"post_url":"/t/setting-up-the-vivid-radio/481073/7","custom_user_title":"mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3479671,"name":"Ada T","username":"cmdada","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cmdada/{size}/230870_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-12T02:52:03.070Z","cooked":"

The radio led is entirely unused in frc firmware, I’d recommend you get familiar with Status Light Quick Reference — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation before making assumptions, they aren’t entirely logical

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-01-12T03:44:36.494Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":97,"readers_count":96,"score":19.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":481073,"topic_slug":"setting-up-the-vivid-radio","display_username":"Ada T","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/hardware/hardware-basics/status-lights-ref.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Status Light Quick Reference — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":70736,"username":"zenman","name":"Steve Nelson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/z/e9a140/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60586,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1157 team captain, 2036 electrical lead 2024"},"post_url":"/t/setting-up-the-vivid-radio/481073/8","custom_user_title":"1157 team captain, 2036 electrical lead 2024","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3479781,"name":"Steve Nelson","username":"zenman","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/z/e9a140/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-12T04:51:10.663Z","cooked":"

We made some minor progress. We were finally able to reimage the rio to the 2025 firmware. The problem we ran into is the roborio imaging tool would not allow us to press the “reformat” button.

So we finally found balena and reimaged through a laptop. We are still struggling with the radio. We can connect to the radio, we have uploaded the firmware. We can connect to the radio via wifi, but we can’t send code through wifi like the old radio could.

When the laptop is connected to the rio via USB the COMM light is on. When we connect to the radio via wifi, then unplug the USB, the COMM light goes out.

When we do that we can ping the radio at: 10.92.14.1 but can’t ping the rio at 10.92.14.2

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-01-12T04:51:10.663Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":84,"readers_count":83,"score":21.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":481073,"topic_slug":"setting-up-the-vivid-radio","display_username":"Steve Nelson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70736,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"mentor"},"post_url":"/t/setting-up-the-vivid-radio/481073/10","custom_user_title":"mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3479846,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-12T07:54:23.949Z","cooked":"
zenman:

The problem we ran into is the roborio imaging tool would not allow us to press the “reformat” button

zenman:

So we finally found balena and reimaged through a laptop

Documentation is your friend. Read it!

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Imaging your roboRIO 2

The NI roboRIO 2.0 boots from a microSD card configured with an appropriate boot image containing the NI Linux Real-Time OS, drivers, and libraries specific to FRC. The microSD card must be imaged ...

zenman:

When the laptop is connected to the rio via USB the COMM light is on. When we connect to the radio via wifi, then unplug the USB, the COMM light goes out.

When we do that we can ping the radio at: 10.92.14.1 but can’t ping the rio at 10.92.14.2

Undoubtedly you skipped a critical step in the above documentation. Specifically the last step.

Again, the documentation is there to help. If you find its unclear or you weren’t able to easily find what you need, make that known so it can be improved.

Why are you both being cryptic?? We spent literally hours reading documentation over and over. I came here as a last resort BECAUSE THE DOCUMENTATION DID NOT WORK.

WHAT LAST STEP??

I stated 23 hours ago that “the roborio imaging tool would not allow us to press the “reformat” button.”

The documentation does not have the reformat button greyed out. Ours does. Our version number does not match the documentation as the documentation is FOURS YEARS OLD. Maybe our version is right. I have no idea! Yes. the docs could be improved. Please stop being cryptic. I’m volunteering my time to help teenagers learn, I’m not a student.

image902×524 60.6 KB

The documentation has the “Edit Startup Settings” radio button set, and says to switch to that mode too, which is what you need.
